name: SpaceWorld 95: A Personalized Horror Experience
description:
In 1997, one of the greatest video games of all time was released - Super Mario 64. It was a massive success, but it could've been much different. In its development phase, the crew developed a new tactic for this peculiar game.

"Every copy is personalized."

The game was reworked into what it is now, due to unforseen circumstances not described to the public. Several copies of the beta were left among the community and have been often talked about.

That's where you come in. You were busy finding games when you find a strange N64 cartridge on a shelf. Its label was peeled off and there was no indication of a title. They end up giving it to you for free and you happily bring it home. What you don't know yet is that you found a beta cartridge for Super Mario 64. Once you begin playing, you might not know what lurks behind that CRT screen.

This is more than just a game.

All rights go to Nintendo
